description: The Biden administration is working on a long-term strategy for supporting Kyiv. But those plans do not anticipate Ukraine taking back territory lost to Russia.
title: U.S. war plans for Ukraine don’t foresee retaking lost territory

description: David Kenner admitted violating a court order and revealing grand jury evidence to Bloomberg News before the trial in a billion-dollar international corruption case.
title: Lawyer for Fugees rapper Pras Michél pleads guilty to leaking evidence

description: The allegations against the U.N. Relief and Workers Agency were raised by Israel; The United States said it was pausing new funding while it reviewed them.
title: U.N. agency fires workers accused of joining Oct. 7 Hamas attack

description: Tawfic Abdel Jabbar, a 17-year-old Palestinian-American, was killed Jan. 19 in the occupied West Bank. His parents are demanding accountability.
title: An American teen was killed in the West Bank. His family wants answers.

description: The decision puts into doubt the future of a U.N.-backed mission to beat back the armed gangs that have taken over vast swaths of Haiti’s capital.
title: Kenyan court blocks police deployment to crisis-racked Haiti

description: Austrian artist Gustav Klimt’s “Portrait of Fräulein Lieser” is going to auction and is expected to fetch up to $54 million.
title: One of Klimt’s ‘most beautiful’ portraits rediscovered after almost 100 years

description: An emergency meeting of the U.N. Security Council on Thursday also yielded no new information about the plane‘s destruction or who was on board.
title: Ukraine says Russia has not given evidence of POWs on downed military plane

description: Boris Nadezhdin says he is running for president of Russia to stop the war. Some skeptics suspect he is a Kremlin stooge but are helping him get on the ballot anyway.
title: This man wants to run against Putin. He just needs 100,000 signatures.

description: The decision focuses on emergency measures to stop the war in Gaza but will not address whether Israel has committed genocide.
title: U.N. court to deliver interim ruling in genocide case against Israel

description: The boundary between Hong Kong and China is dissolving as the governments in both places plan development projects that will accelerate integration.
title: China is absorbing Hong Kong, as geography follows politics

description: The U.S. military has abruptly reversed course on some — but not all — of its plans to partner with those involved in coups or accused of human rights abuses.
title: Pentagon, under scrutiny, halts work with condemned foreign militaries

description: South Africa requested that the World Court order Israel to suspend military operations in Gaza. Justices will not rule on genocide allegations immediately.
title: Israel-Gaza war live updates: International Court of Justice to rule on ordering Israel to halt fighting

description: As the case gets litigated, it also has tapped into a pronounced global divide.
title: South Africa’s genocide case against Israel spotlights a global divide
